title: 'Old Practice To Blame Neighbours': India Condemns Pakistan Airstrikes On Afghanistan - News18
summary:
India Condemns Pakistan Airstrikes on Afghanistan

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: News18

The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) of India condemned the recent Pakistani airstrikes in Afghanistan that resulted in the deaths of over 40 individuals, calling it an "old habit" of Pakistan to blame its neighbors for its failures.

  • India's MEA noted the media reports on the airstrikes affecting civilians in Afghanistan.
  • The Pakistani airstrikes occurred in the Barmal district of Paktika province.
  • At least 46 people, including women and children, were reported dead.
  • Major casualties were reported in Laman, including five members of a single family.
  • The airstrikes led to cross-border clashes between Afghan forces and Pakistani paramilitary soldiers.
  • India condemned the attack on innocent civilians.
“We unequivocally condemn any attack on innocent civilians. It is an old practice of Pakistan to blame its neighbours for its own internal failures.” - Randhir Jaiswal

This incident has raised tensions at the border, with violent clashes following the attacks.
newTitle: India Condemns Pakistan Airstrikes on Afghanistan

title: HMPV Symptoms And Treatment: How Common Is The Virus And How To Take Care Of Its Patients? - News18
summary:
HMPV Symptoms And Treatment: How Common Is The Virus And How To Take Care Of Its Patients?

Last Updated: January 06, 2025, 23:06 IST

Source: News18

The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has detected two cases of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Karnataka. Both patients are recovering, and there is no indication of significant travel history.

  • Two cases of HMPV confirmed in Karnataka.
  • Symptoms include cough, fever, and respiratory issues.
  • Transmission occurs through direct contact and contaminated surfaces.
  • No unusual surge in respiratory illnesses reported in India.
  • WHO is monitoring the situation and providing updates.
"Most cases are mild, but about 5% to 16% of children will develop a lower respiratory tract infection like pneumonia."

Healthcare providers diagnose HMPV based on symptoms. Prevention measures include hand hygiene and avoiding close contact with sick individuals.
newTitle: Understanding HMPV: Symptoms, Treatment, and Prevalence

title: Winter Vacation: These States And Cities Closed Schools Due To Cold Wave - News18
Winter Vacation: These States And Cities Closed Schools Due To Cold Wave - News18
HMPV cases LIVE: 5 cases in India, govt asks people to not panic as #lockdown trends - Hindustan Times
Nimisha Priya case handled by Houthis, not ratified by president: Yemen embassy - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nimisha Priya's Death Sentence in Yemen: Embassy Clarifies Houthi Control

Publication Date: Jan 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The death sentence imposed on Indian nurse Nimisha Priya by a Yemeni court is controlled by the Houthi militia and has not been ratified by President Rashad al-Alimi, according to Yemen's embassy.

  • Nimisha Priya is currently in jail in Sana'a, Yemen, which is under Houthi control.
  • She was sentenced to death for the murder of a Yemeni citizen in 2017.
  • The Yemeni embassy clarified the case did not receive presidential approval.
  • India is offering all possible help to assist Nimisha Priya.
  • Priya’s mother has been fundraising to pay “blood money” to secure her release.
This is my final plea. She has only a few days left. I beg the Centre and the council to do everything possible to save her life.

Efforts for her rescue are ongoing, involving both the Indian government and international offers of assistance.
newTitle: Nimisha Priya's Death Sentence in Yemen: Embassy Clarifies Houthi Control

title: Global HMPV Tracker: Tamil Nadu Detects 2 Cases, India's Tally Rises To 5 - NDTV
summary:
Global HMPV Tracker: Tamil Nadu Detects 2 Cases, India's Tally Rises To 5

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 Source: NDTV

This article discusses the detection of five cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in India, with two cases reported in Tamil Nadu, marking the first reported instances of this virus in the country.

  • Five confirmed cases of HMPV in India, first reported on January 6, 2025.
  • Two cases in Bengaluru: a three-month-old baby discharged and an eight-month-old in recovery.
  • One case each reported in Tamil Nadu cities Chennai and Salem, with a two-month-old found infected in Ahmedabad.
  • Union Health Ministry confirmed no recent travel history among affected families, ruling out exposure from abroad.
  • The ICMR is monitoring HMPV trends and urges preparedness similar to Covid-19 guidelines.
“Health experts have clarified that HMPV is not a new virus. It was first identified in 2001 and it has been circulating in the entire world since many years.” - Union Health Minister JP Nadda

This outbreak of HMPV highlights the ongoing respiratory virus concerns in the context of global health and emphasizes the importance of monitoring and preparedness.
newTitle: Global HMPV Tracker: Tamil Nadu Detects 2 Cases, India's Tally Rises To 5

title: Patna court grants bail to Prashant Kishor sans conditions - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Patna Court Grants Unconditional Bail to Prashant Kishor

Date: January 2024

Source: News Article

Prashant Kishor, leader of Jan Suraaj, was granted unconditional bail by a Patna court following his initial detention and conditions imposed on his bail.

  • Kishor was earlier sent to judicial custody after being detained during a fast-unto-death protest.
  • His lawyer successfully argued for unconditional bail, leading to a revision of the previous conditions.
  • The initial bail required a bond of ₹25,000 and restricted Kishor from participating in any protests.
  • Protests sparked by allegations of irregularities in the Bihar Public Service Commission examination demanded the cancellation of the exam.
  • A fresh examination was conducted on January 4, with only 5,943 out of 12,000 candidates attending.
“The re-examination was an admission of the mistakes that had occurred.” - Prashant Kishor

The bail granted indicates a significant legal victory for Kishor amidst ongoing political protests in Bihar.
newTitle: Patna Court Grants Unconditional Bail to Prashant Kishor

title: Centre Notifies Appointment Of Two Advocates As Delhi High Court Judges - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Centre Notifies Appointment Of Two Advocates As Delhi High Court Judges

Publication Date: January 6, 2025

Source: Live Law

The Central government has officially appointed Ajay Digpaul and Harish Vaidyanathan Shankar as judges of the Delhi High Court, following a recommendation by the Supreme Court Collegium.

  • The Supreme Court Collegium recommended their appointment in August 2024.
  • The Delhi High Court currently has 42 judges against a sanctioned strength of 60.
“In exercise of the power conferred by the Constitution of India, the President of India, after consultation with Chief Justice of India, is pleased to appoint the following as Judges. I convey my best wishes to them: - pic.twitter.com/CGjz65R4TM” — Arjun Ram Meghwal (@arjunrammeghwal), January 6, 2025

This appointment reflects the ongoing adjustments within the judiciary and aims to fill vacancies in the Delhi High Court to improve its functionality.
newTitle: Central Government Appoints Two New Judges to Delhi High Court

title: US to delist Indian nuclear entities, says Jake Sullivan at meet with NSA Ajit Doval - Hindustan Times
summary:
US to Delist Indian Nuclear Entities, Says Jake Sullivan at Meet with NSA Ajit Doval

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The United States is set to finalize steps to delist Indian nuclear entities, enhancing civil nuclear cooperation and fortifying clean energy supply chains, as announced by National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan.

  • The announcement was made during a meeting with NSA Ajit Doval.
  • Sullivan provided updates on the Biden administration's missile export control policies aimed at improving US commercial space cooperation with India.
  • They reviewed progress in high-level dialogue across defence, cyber, and maritime security.
  • Concrete initiatives have been driven since the launch of the India-US Initiative on Critical and Emerging Technologies (iCET) in May 2022.
“I would like to recognise my counterpart, the National Indian National Security Advisor Ajit Doval, because it was in part his vision...” - Jake Sullivan

In conclusion, the US plans to strengthen its relationship with India through key initiatives that emphasize technology and security cooperation.
newTitle: US to Delist Indian Nuclear Entities, Promoting Civil Nuclear Cooperation

title: New Osmania General Hospital foundation to be laid within a week: Telangana CM - The Siasat Daily
summary:
New Osmania General Hospital foundation to be laid within a week: Telangana CM

Date: January 6, 2025 Source: The Siasat Daily

Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy announced that the foundation stone for the new Osmania General Hospital building will be laid within a week, highlighting a commitment to infrastructural development in the Old City.

  • The foundation stone for the Osmania General Hospital will be laid at Goshamahal Stadium.
  • A special meeting with legislators is scheduled to discuss developmental works in the Old City.
  • Funds will be released for the long-pending Charminar Pedestrian Project.
  • The cable-stayed bridge at Mir Alam Tank is set to be completed in two years.
“I will ensure that funds are released, but you should get the work done.” – CM Revanth Reddy

The historical context surrounding the hospital reflects Hyderabad's growth and development, showcasing its architectural significance and urban evolution.
newTitle: Foundation for New Osmania General Hospital to be Laid Soon

title: HMPV cases LIVE: ‘Virus not new, no need to panic’, says govt as #lockdown trends on X - Hindustan Times
summary:
HMPV cases LIVE: ‘Virus not new, no need to panic’, says govt as #lockdown trends on X

Date: January 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The government reassured the public that HMPV is not a new virus after confirming three cases in India. Health experts emphasize there is no need to panic as the virus resembles a regular flu.

  • Three cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) confirmed in India, two in Karnataka and one in Gujarat.
  • Cases detected in children; health officials stress that there is no cause for alarm.
  • Regular flu shots provide immunity; HMPV is not as transmissible as Covid-19.
  • Health ministry reports no unusual surge in related respiratory illnesses in the country.
“HMPV has been circulating for years and there is no reason to panic.” – Health Minister JP Nadda

The health officials are actively monitoring the situation, ensuring preparedness to handle any potential increase in respiratory illnesses.
newTitle: HMPV cases LIVE: ‘Virus not new, no need to panic’, says govt as #lockdown trends on X

title: NEP 2020 alignment: UGC proposes major overhaul in teacher recruitment - The Times of India
summary:
UGC Proposes Major Overhaul in Teacher Recruitment Aligned with NEP 2020

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Times of India

The University Grants Commission (UGC) has announced significant changes in the teacher recruitment process to align with the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, aiming to enhance the quality of education in India.

  • The UGC's proposals include new eligibility criteria and a standardized examination for prospective teachers.
  • Emphasis will be placed on thorough training and qualifications to improve teaching quality.
  • Changes are expected to affect higher education institutions across the country.
“This will be a landmark change in how we approach teacher recruitment, ensuring that quality teachers are in our classrooms,” stated a UGC official.

This overhaul is seen as a crucial step towards improving India's educational standards and ensuring that teachers are well-equipped to meet the challenges of modern education.
newTitle: UGC Proposes Major Overhaul in Teacher Recruitment Aligned with NEP 2020

title: HMPV not new virus in India: Health Ministry says as cases detected - The Hindu
summary:
HMPV Not a New Virus in India, Health Ministry Clarifies Amid Cases

Published on: January 06, 2025 by The Hindu

The Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) is already in circulation globally, including in India, with cases reported but no alarming increase according to the Health Ministry. Health experts assure that the virus is not new and precautions are necessary.

  • The HMPV has been circulating since its identification in 2001.
  • Current cases in India do not involve individuals with travel history.
  • Health systems remain vigilant without significant risk to the public.
  • Precautions similar to those for common cold are recommended.
  • Health Departments are monitoring and issuing advisories to handle potential spread.
“It’s a known virus that causes respiratory infections, mostly mild.” - Soumya Swaminathan, former chief scientist, WHO

Overall, there is no reason for panic as the health systems are managing the situation effectively.
newTitle: HMPV Not a New Virus in India, Health Ministry Clarifies Amid Cases

title: Several workers feared trapped in Assam coal mine after water seeps in: Officials - Hindustan Times
summary:
Several Workers Feared Trapped in Assam Coal Mine After Water Seepage

Publication Date: Jan 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

An unspecified number of workers are feared trapped inside a coal mine in Assam’s Dima Hasao district after underground water seeped into the mine on Monday morning.

  • Location of the mine is remote and not easily accessible.
  • Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has stated that disturbing news has come from Umrangshu.
  • The mine is operated by the state government's mines and minerals department.
  • Rescue operations have been requested from the Army and local disaster response forces.
  • Last seen, workers entered the mine at approximately 9 AM on January 6, 2025.
“Distressing news from Umrangshu, where laborers are trapped in a coal mine. The exact number and status are yet unknown.” - Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma

Rescue efforts are expected to begin at 6 AM on Tuesday due to darkness and accessibility issues.
newTitle: Several Workers Feared Trapped in Assam Coal Mine After Water Seepage

title: UGC issues draft norms to allow domain experts as V-Cs. Those without teaching experience eligible too - ThePrint
summary:
UGC issues draft norms to allow domain experts as V-Cs. Those without teaching experience eligible too

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: ThePrint

The UGC has released draft guidelines aimed at revising the qualifications for appointing Vice-Chancellors and faculty members in higher education institutions, allowing for industry professionals to qualify without traditional teaching experience.

Key Points:

  • UGC proposes to allow industry experts with 10 years of senior-level experience to become Vice-Chancellors.
  • The new guidelines aim to broaden recruitment criteria for faculty selection in line with the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020.
  • The draft replaces the 2018 guidelines and invites feedback from the public.
  • Direct entry for individuals from diverse fields, such as Yoga and Performing Arts, is encouraged.
  • The API system is being phased out in favor of a qualitative assessment for faculty promotion.
“These regulations also facilitate the selection of faculty members from multi-disciplinary backgrounds.” - UGC chairperson M. Jagadesh Kumar

In conclusion, these proposed changes by the UGC aim to modernize higher education governance, promoting inclusivity and flexibility in academic leadership and recruitment.
newTitle: UGC Proposes New Norms for Vice-Chancellors and Faculty Recruitment

title: Know traffic restrictions in Bhubaneswar for Pravasi Bharatiya Divas - OTV News
Nine laborers trapped in Assam coal mine; Army sends relief task force - The Times of India
summary:
Rescue Efforts Underway for Nine Coal Miners Trapped in Assam

Publication Date: October 23, 2023 Source: Times of India

Nine laborers are trapped in a coal mine in Assam, prompting the Army to deploy a relief task force to assist with rescue operations.

  • Rescue teams have been mobilized to reach the trapped individuals.
  • Initial assessments indicate the miners have been stuck for several hours.
  • Local authorities are coordinating with the Army for effective rescue efforts.
  • Community support is being organized to provide aid to the families of the trapped miners.
“We are making every effort to bring them back to safety,” said a local official.

The situation is critical as rescuers work against the clock to save the trapped miners, highlighting the ongoing risks faced by workers in hazardous occupations.
newTitle: Rescue Efforts Underway for Nine Coal Miners Trapped in Assam

title: Karnataka HC setback for Atul Subhash's wife: 'What more do you want?' - Moneycontrol
summary:
Karnataka HC Denies Quashing FIR Against Atul Subhash's Wife

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: Moneycontrol

The Karnataka High Court has denied Nikita Singhania's plea to quash the FIR against her in connection with the abetment to suicide case of her husband, Atul Subhash.

  • Atul Subhash, a software engineer from Bengaluru, died by suicide last month, alleging mental harassment by his wife and her family.
  • The High Court found prima facie evidence supporting the FIR's claims.
  • Nikita's lawyer contended that the FIR lacked sufficient grounds, but the court disagreed, emphasizing the detailed nature of the complaint.
“My reading of this complaint is that ingredients are made out. And it is not a case of quashing.” - Justice SR Krishna Kumar

This ruling signifies a significant legal turnaround for Nikita Singhania amidst serious allegations against her.
newTitle: Karnataka HC Denies Quashing FIR Against Atul Subhash's Wife

title: E Srinivas appointed as first DRM of Jammu Rail Division - Greater Kashmir
summary:
E Srinivas Appointed as the First DRM of Jammu Rail Division

Date: January 06, 2023 Source: Greater Kashmir

A new railway division in Jammu has been inaugurated, with E Srinivas appointed as its first Divisional Railway Manager (DRM). This move is aimed at enhancing railway operations in the region.

  • E Srinivas appointed as the first DRM of Jammu Rail Division.
  • The division was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • The division includes rail operations from Pathankot to Baramulla, covering a total of 742.1 km.
  • It aims to boost tourism and economic development in Jammu & Kashmir.
  • The new division was carved out from the Firozpur division.
“The division will lead to development of railway operations in Jammu & Kashmir. The new train services that connect Kashmir valley with the rest of the country will bring more tourism. It will boost economic development of Jammu & Kashmir.” - Dilip Kumar, Executive Director, Railway Board

This development marks a significant step in improving rail connectivity in Jammu and Kashmir.
newTitle: E Srinivas Appointed as the First DRM of Jammu Rail Division

title: KTR Gets Another Notice From ACB: What’s Up? - Gulte
summary:
KTR Faces ACB Notice Over Formula E Scam Allegations

Published on: 7:01 pm, 6 January 2025 | Source: GulteDesk

The former IT minister of Telangana, KTR, is being investigated by the ACB and ED regarding the Formula E scam, involving a contentious Rs 55 crore transaction. He was denied entry to the ACB office due to his legal team's presence and has been summoned for another investigation on January 9.

  • KTR has been accused of consenting to a transaction that violates regulations.
  • He was barred from entering the ACB office with his lawyers present.
  • Another notice has been issued for him to appear without legal representation.
  • There were unverified reports of search operations at KTR's residence.
  • The outcome of this investigation remains uncertain.
KTR is reluctant to participate in the investigation absent his legal team.

This ongoing situation raises concerns about the integrity of the investigation and KTR's ability to defend himself adequately.
newTitle: KTR Faces ACB Notice Over Formula E Scam Allegations

title: BPSC protest: Patna court sends Prashant Kishor to judicial custody - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
BPSC Protest: Prashant Kishor Sent to Judicial Custody

Published on: 06 Jan 2025, 1:27 pm

A court in Patna has sent Prashant Kishor, a leader of Jan Suraaj, to judicial custody following his detention by Bihar police during a fast-unto-death protest at Gandhi Maidan.

  • Kishor was detained during a protest on January 2 in solidarity with students demanding the cancellation of the BPSC - 70th Combined Competitive Examination.
  • The court granted bail with a ₹25,000 bond and conditions against further protests.
  • Kishor's lawyer sought unconditional bail, arguing the legality of his protest.
  • Protests were triggered by claims of irregularities in the BPSC exam, with Kishor criticizing the government's decision for a re-examination.
  • Out of 12,000 candidates, only 5,943 attended the recent re-examination on January 4.
“The court lacks the authority to review the order; approach the High Court if you disagree,” stated the judge.

This protest highlights the tensions surrounding the BPSC examination and could have lasting implications for public trust in the examination process.
newTitle: BPSC Protest: Prashant Kishor Sent to Judicial Custody

title: Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Delhi Issue Guidelines As 3 Cases Reported In India - NDTV
summary:
Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Delhi Issue Guidelines As 3 Cases Reported In India

Date: January 6, 2025 Source: NDTV

Three cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) were confirmed in India, marking the first reported instances of the virus in the country. The Union health ministry is monitoring the situation closely.

Key Points:

  • Confirmed cases in Bengaluru and Ahmedabad.
  • Guidelines issued by Karnataka, Maharashtra, and Delhi governments.
  • Most of the Indian population is reportedly immune to HMPV.
“HMPV is not a new virus. It has been part of the circulating flu virus in India for long.” - Dr. Harshal R Salve

The outbreak has prompted precautions similar to those taken during the COVID-19 pandemic, as health officials remain vigilant.
newTitle: Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Delhi Issue Guidelines As 3 Cases Reported In India

title: Kerala Court grants bail to MLA PV Anvar in forest office vandalism case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Kerala Court Grants Bail to MLA PV Anvar in Forest Office Vandalism Case

Date: Monday

Source: Mathrubhumi

Kerala Member of Legislative Assembly PV Anvar was granted bail in a case regarding vandalism at a District Forest Office in Nilambur.

  • Anvar, an Independent MLA, was arrested from his residence on Sunday night.
  • The bail was granted by the Nilambur Judicial First Class Magistrate Court.
  • He recently left the CPI(M) led ruling Left Democratic Front and now leads the Democratic Movement of Kerala.
  • Protests erupted after a tribal man died in an elephant attack, leading to DMK workers vandalizing the DFO.
  • Anvar and others were charged under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and the Prevention of Damage to Public Property Act.
The arrest drew heavy criticism from opposition parties, who accused the government of political retaliation against Anvar.

This case highlights ongoing tensions and allegations of corruption in Kerala's political landscape.
newTitle: Kerala Court Grants Bail to MLA PV Anvar in Forest Office Vandalism Case

title: GATE Admit Card 2025 Live: When and from where can I download hall tickets? - The Indian Express
summary:
GATE Admit Card 2025 Live: When and from where can I download hall tickets?

Date & Source: January 7, Indian Express

The GATE 2025 admit cards will be released by IIT Roorkee on January 7, available for download at the official website gate2025.iitr.ac.in.

  • The GATE exam is scheduled from February 1 to February 16, 2025.
  • Admit cards must be verified for correctness; discrepancies should be reported to the GATE administering body.
  • Candidates can apply for one or two test papers out of 30 available.
  • Exams will be held in forenoon (9.30 am - 12.30 pm) and afternoon (2.30 pm - 5.30 pm) sessions.
“GATE is an entrance test for admission to master’s and doctoral programmes and recruitment by some public sector undertakings.”

It's crucial for candidates to download their admit cards promptly and check for any errors, ensuring they are fully prepared for the examination.

title: Advance tech is the basis of India- US future ties : NSA Sullivan - Hindustan Times
summary:
Advance tech is the basis of India- US future ties : NSA Sullivan

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi met United States National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan on his farewell visit to India, discussing the future relationship between the two nations based on advanced technology.

  • Sullivan's visit comes as he prepares to leave office with the impending inauguration of Donald Trump.
  • The importance of the Initiative on Critical and Emerging Technology (iCET) was highlighted, aiming to enhance collaboration in fields like AI, semiconductors, and defense.
  • Sullivan noted that the U.S. is finalizing steps to enable civil nuclear cooperation between the two countries.
  • Prior discussions included meetings with Indian officials including National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar.
“Advanced technologies of the future should take the relationship into the future…to make the world a better place for everyone.” - Jake Sullivan

The ongoing discussions between India and the U.S. signify a deepening partnership that is expected to pave new pathways in technology and defense cooperation.
newTitle: Advance tech is the basis of India- US future ties : NSA Sullivan

title: At Least 9 Dead After Naxalites Blow Up Police Vehicle In Chhattisgarh's Bijapur - News18
China says its world's biggest dam over Brahmaputra will not impact water flows to India - The Hindu
summary:
China Assures No Negative Impact from World's Biggest Dam on Brahmaputra River

Date: January 06, 2025
Source: The Hindu

China has reaffirmed its commitment to building the world's largest dam over the Brahmaputra River in Tibet, stating that the project will not adversely affect water flows to India and Bangladesh as it undergoes rigorous scientific evaluation.

  • The dam project is estimated to cost around ₹137 billion.
  • Guo Jiakun, a Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson, asserts that the dam will aid disaster prevention and climate response.
  • Concerns from India regarding potential impacts on downstream water resources have been voiced, and India plans to monitor the situation closely.
  • The project is located in a seismic zone, raising ecological concerns due to frequent earthquakes in the region.
  • China maintains that the dam will not negatively affect lower riparian states based on decades of studies.
“The project will not negatively affect the lower reaches,” - Mao Ning, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson.

In conclusion, while China promotes the dam as beneficial, India remains cautious and committed to protecting its water rights as a downstream nation.
newTitle: China Assures No Negative Impact from World's Biggest Dam on Brahmaputra River

title: GATE 2025 Admit Card To Be Released Tomorrow at gate2025.iitr.ac, Steps To Download - News18
summary:
GATE 2025 Admit Card To Be Released Tomorrow at gate2025.iitr.ac, Steps To Download

Last Updated: January 06, 2025, 23:37 IST

GATE 2025 Admit Card: The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Roorkee, will release the admit cards for the Graduate Aptitude Test for Engineering (GATE) 2025 tomorrow, January 7, 2025. Candidates who have registered for the examination can download the hall tickets through the official website – gate2025.iitr.ac, once out.

The examination will be conducted in computer-based test (CBT) mode over four days.

GATE Admit Card 2025: Steps To Download

  • Step 1: Visit the official GATE website – gate2025.iitr.ac
  • Step 2: Click on the ‘GATE 2025 Admit Card’ link
  • Step 3: Enter your login credentials like registration number and password
  • Step 4: Click on the submit button to view your hall ticket
  • Step 5: Download and print the admit card for the exam day

GATE 2025 Exam Pattern

Each exam paper will be worth 100 marks, with a marking scheme that includes negative marking for wrong answers in the MCQ section.
newTitle: GATE 2025 Admit Card To Be Released Tomorrow at gate2025.iitr.ac, Steps To Download
